intro: Calophanes palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's calophane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Calophanes palmeri is adapted to arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
